page.title: 08WEDDING GOWNS
page.content: ST LAWRENCE'S CHURCH LINDRIDGE ON FRIDAY EVENING, 5TH JULY, 1985 WAS THE SCENE FOR A FASHION SHOW ENTITLED "200 YEARS OF WEDDING GOWNS".THE EARLIEST ONE WAS 1740,THE LATEST 1973.THE AUDIENCE COULD SEE THE DIFFERENT STYLES,TEXTURES,DESIGNS AND LEARN FROM ANN MARIE SHERWOOD,THE GOWNS'OWNER,A LITTLE OF THEIR HISTORY. THE REFRESHMENT INTERVAL PROVED A HECTIC TIME FOR THE ORGANIZERS AND HELPERS BUT VERY WELCOME TO THE AUDIENCE.THE LAST GOWN TO BE MODELLED WAS A COPY OF PRINCESS ANNE'S WEDDING DRESS.THE AUDIENCE LEFT FOR HOME,THE WEDDING GOWNS WERE PACKED AWAY AND THE LADIES OF THE COMMITTE RETIRED TO THE KITCHEN TO WASH UP!.TICKETS FOR THE EVENT WERE Â£2.00 EACH AND ABOUT Â£160 PROFIT WAS MADE FOR CHURCH FUNDS.
